00001 ######################################################################
00002 # Name:    texttools.tcl
00003 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00004 # Date:    05/21/2013
00005 # Brief:   Namespace containing procedures to manipulate text in the
00006 #          current text widget.
00007 ######################################################################
00008 
00009 namespace eval texttools {
00010 
00011   ######################################################################
00012   # Comments out the currently selected text.
00013   proc comment {tid} {
00014 
00015     # Get the current text widget
00016     set txt [gui::current_txt $tid]
00017 
00018     # Create a separator
00019     $txt edit separator
00020 
00021     # Get the selection ranges
00022     set selected [$txt tag ranges sel]
00023 
00024     # Get the comment syntax
00025     lassign [syntax::get_comments $txt] icomment lcomments bcomments
00026 
00027     # Insert comment lines/blocks
00028     foreach {endpos startpos} [lreverse $selected] {
00029       if {[llength $icomment] == 1} {
00030         set i 0
00031         foreach line [split [$txt get $startpos $endpos] \n] {
00032           if {$i == 0} {
00033             $txt insert $startpos "[lindex $icomment 0]"
00034             $txt tag add sel $startpos "$startpos lineend"
00035           } else {
00036             $txt insert "$startpos+${i}l linestart" "[lindex $icomment 0]"
00037           }
00038           incr i
00039         }
00040       } else {
00041         $txt insert $endpos   "[lindex $icomment 1]"
00042         $txt insert $startpos "[lindex $icomment 0]"
00043         if {[lindex [split $startpos .] 0] == [lindex [split $endpos .] 0]} {
00044           set endpos "$endpos+[expr [string length [lindex $icomment 0]] + [string length [lindex $icomment 1]]]c"
00045         } else {
00046           set endpos "$endpos+[string length [lindex $icomment 1]]c"
00047         }
00048         $txt tag add sel $startpos $endpos
00049       }
00050     }
00051 
00052     # Create a separator
00053     $txt edit separator
00054 
00055   }
00056 
00057   ######################################################################
00058   # Uncomments out the currently selected text in the current text
00059   # widget.
00060   proc uncomment {tid} {
00061 
00062     # Get the current text widget
00063     set txt [gui::current_txt $tid]
00064 
00065     # Create a separator
00066     $txt edit separator
00067 
00068     # Get the selection ranges
00069     set selected [$txt tag ranges sel]
00070 
00071     # Get the comment syntax
00072     lassign [syntax::get_comments $txt] icomment lcomments bcomments
00073 
00074     # Get the comment syntax to remove
00075     set comments [join [eval concat $lcomments $bcomments] |]
00076 
00077     # Strip out comment syntax
00078     foreach {endpos startpos} [lreverse $selected] {
00079       set linestart $startpos
00080       foreach line [split [$txt get $startpos $endpos] \n] {
00081         while {[regexp -indices -- ".*($comments)" $line -> com]} {
00082           set delstart [$txt index "$linestart+[lindex $com 0]c"]
00083           set delend   [$txt index "$linestart+[expr [lindex $com 1] + 1]c"]
00084           $txt delete $delstart $delend
00085           set line [string replace $line {*}$com]
00086         }
00087         set linestart [$txt index "$linestart+1l linestart"]
00088         incr i
00089       }
00090     }
00091 
00092     # Create a separator
00093     $txt edit separator
00094 
00095   }
00096 
00097   ######################################################################
00098   # Indents the selected text of the current text widget by one
00099   # indentation level.
00100   proc indent {tid} {
00101 
00102     # Get the current text widget
00103     set txt [gui::current_txt $tid]
00104 
00105     # Create a separator
00106     $txt edit separator
00107 
00108     # Get the selection ranges
00109     set selected [$txt tag ranges sel]
00110 
00111     foreach {endpos startpos} [lreverse $selected] {
00112       while {[$txt index "$startpos linestart"] <= [$txt index "$endpos linestart"]} {
00113         $txt insert "$startpos linestart" "  "
00114         set startpos [$txt index "$startpos linestart+1l"]
00115       }
00116     }
00117 
00118     # Create a separator
00119     $txt edit separator
00120 
00121   }
00122 
00123   ######################################################################
00124   # Unindents the selected text of the current text widget by one
00125   # indentation level.
00126   proc unindent {tid} {
00127 
00128     # Get the current text widget
00129     set txt [gui::current_txt $tid]
00130 
00131     # Create a separator
00132     $txt edit separator
00133 
00134     # Get the selection ranges
00135     set selected [$txt tag ranges sel]
00136 
00137     foreach {endpos startpos} [lreverse $selected] {
00138       while {[$txt index "$startpos linestart"] <= [$txt index "$endpos linestart"]} {
00139         if {[regexp {^  } [$txt get "$startpos linestart" "$startpos lineend"]]} {
00140           $txt delete "$startpos linestart" "$startpos linestart+2c"
00141         }
00142         set startpos [$txt index "$startpos linestart+1l"]
00143       }
00144     }
00145 
00146     # Create a separator
00147     $txt edit separator
00148 
00149   }
00150 
00151   ######################################################################
00152   # Replaces the current line with the output contents of it as a script.
00153   proc replace_line_with_script {tid} {
00154 
00155     # Get the current text widget
00156     set txt [gui::current_txt $tid]
00157 
00158     # Get the current line
00159     set cmd [$txt get "insert linestart" "insert lineend"]
00160 
00161     # Execute the line text
00162     catch { exec -ignorestderr {*}$cmd } rc
00163 
00164     # Replace the line with the given text
00165     $txt replace "insert linestart" "insert lineend" $rc
00166 
00167   }
00168 
00169   ######################################################################
00170   # Returns true if the current line is empty; otherwise, returns false.
00171   proc current_line_empty {tid} {
00172 
00173     # Get the current text widget
00174     set txt [gui::current_txt $tid]
00175 
00176     return [expr {[$txt get "insert linestart" "insert lineend"] eq ""}]
00177 
00178   }

00181   # Aligns the current cursors.
00182   proc align {tid} {
00183 
00184     # Get the current text widget
00185     set txt [gui::current_txt $tid]
00186 
00187     # Align multicursors
00188     multicursor::align $txt
00189 
00190   }

00192   ######################################################################
00193   # Inserts an enumeration when in multicursor mode.
00194   proc insert_enumeration {tid} {
00195 
00196     # Get the current text widget
00197     set txt [gui::current_txt $tid]
00198 
00199     # Perform the insertion
00200     gui::insert_numbers $txt
00201 
00202   }
